feed.title: Intelligent Autonomy Lab
feed.subtitle: A robotics and controls lab located at Yale University.

entry.title: Papers Accepted to IROS!
entry.content:
Congrats to Elena and collaborators from Northwestern University, Motional, and Carnegie Mellon University on their papers!

Check out the papers below!

Bi-Level Image-Guided Ergodic Exploration with Applications to Planetary Rovers

Learning stable models for prediction and control

Multi-Agent Multi-Objective Ergodic Search Using Branch and Bound
entry.summary: Congrats to Elena and collaborators from Northwestern University, Motional, and Carnegie Mellon University on their papers!

entry.title: Time Ergodic Search Wins Best Paper Award at RSS

link.title: Time Ergodic Search Wins Best Paper Award at RSS

entry.content:
Congrats to Dayi Dong, Henry Berger, and Ian Abraham for winning the Best Paper Award at the Robotics: Science and Systems Conference in Deagu, South Korea for their work on Time-Optimal Ergodic Search!

For more information about the work, check out our social media posts twitter and linkedin and the paper!

TLDR: We derive solutions to the time-optimal ergodic coverage problem which is fundamental to many robotics problems in mapping, exploration, search and rescue, and environmental monitoring!
entry.summary: Congrats to Dayi Dong, Henry Berger, and Ian Abraham for winning the Best Paper Award at the Robotics: Science and Systems Conference in Deagu, South Korea for their work on Time-Optimal Ergodic Search!

entry.content: Ethan (Dayi) and Henry present their work on time-optimal ergodic search! Check out their great presentation here!

entry.title: Cameron and Ethan Present at ICRA

link.title: Cameron and Ethan Present at ICRA

entry.content:
Cameron and Ethan (Dayi) present their work on safety-critical ergodic control at ICRA in London!

TLDR: we present a method for guaranteed safe, continuous ergodic coverage planning for robotic systems in cluttered environments through integrating ergodic trajectory optimization with control barrier functions!

Check out the social media post here and paper!
entry.summary: Cameron and Ethan (Dayi) present their work on safety-critical ergodic control at ICRA in London!

entry.content:
